replies.body:
Whenever I see this GIF, I imagine what it would feel like to have a spider in my mouth.


Then I go into my room and cry for the rest of the day.
Don't humans eat spiders in their sleep? :3
and that would be the same reason doctors put you to sleep before performing open heart surgery as well
OMG NO WHY WOULD YOU SAY THATJTIFJLKESDFNJLFN
I got so much satisfaction from watching that

Three. . .

Two. . .

One. . .

Agreement has landed.
I thought countdowns were for liftoff.
Great, now I want a pet Iguana. Eat up those nasty spiders for me.

I believe that's a frilled lizard actually...
It's a bearded dragon. In case anyone wants one.
These lackluster lizards have nothing on the majesty of a Bearded Dragon.

Sooooooo..... {{champion:58}} ?
AS I LIVE, ALL WILL DIE!

Sorta related: I was watching the gif and saw the lizard walking up to the spider, and then during the brief stare-down of the lizard to the spider, I heard buzzing in my room and damn near shit myself thinking "REVENGE OF THE INSECTS!" Holy crap that was terrifying. 

Love and hate this gif at the same time.

spiders are arachnids not insects

noob
There's always the one person who has to correct it for some reason

its because of the arachnid rebellion of '48. it was brutal, with the insects aerial tactics the arachnid minority would never have stood a chance without their inventive methods of guerilla warfare, the war ended with a signed treaty officially stating arachnids as a separate entity to insects. its also a note that the guerilla arachnid faction still operates in homes to piss off humans.
not enough upvotes, also you traitor the arachnid faction protects us from the scum known as the insects

If someone called a lizard a bird, wouldn't you say something? o.O

Or, if I called a rock a cat, I would get strange looks.

Maybe it didn't warrant the correcting, but some people are bound to notice and pointing it out is natural for some people. If someone I knew accidentally called a phone booth the bathroom, I'd look at them funny.

[> Is it really Elise though?](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4E5vUUtSWT4)

NOPE NOPE NOPE NOPE NOPE NOPE NOPE NOPE NOPE NOPE NOPE!!!!

Get that out of my mind. I don't want it to be {{champion:63}} ed into my memory.
Nature at its ~~finest~~ disguisting-est.

{{champion:96}} Nurf pls

Whenever I see a spider I grab my cat and let it smack it around till it dies. I am not going to deal with a spider.
Same. My cat loves to kill bugs. It's so satisfying to wake up in the morning and see dead spiders, roaches, centipedes, etc. on the floor.
